item.title: Display backtrace when a program segfaults
item.description: Display backtrace when a program segfaults When an application crashes, with a segfault for example it can be usefull have debugging help like a stacktrace of function calls. This can be achieved by trapping the SIGSEGV unix signal and by using the backtrace(3) and backtrace_symbols(3) GNU extensions functions. Intercept SIGSEGV signal (and others) This is done via the traditional use of sigaction: #include <signal.h> struct sigaction handler; sigemptyset(&handler.sa_mask); handler.sa_flags = SA_NODEFER | SA_RESETHAND; handler.
